data.title: [UI] Capture TurboBadger hashtable fix from repo
data.body:
There may be other updates in the TB repo that can be rolled in, this hashtable one would be good:

https://github.com/fruxo/turbobadger/commit/898cc72c1c3e771b62aed887a7ee53a6ffb421dd

data.title: [AtomicNET] Small API improvements (multi-issue for reporting weird casts, lack of syntax sugar, minor annoyances)

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
This is a multi-issue for small improvements regarding the AtomicNET API. Please feel free to comment here when you find something counterintuitive, odd, confusing or simply lacking in the API.
Newbie reports are welcome even if you're not sure it's a valid point since the intention here is to increase the quality and intuitiveness of the API, so whenever you find something that doesn't look right, feel free to comment here.
Suggestions and opinions are welcome, as well as pull requests, although you don't have to use this at all if you have a pull request.
Eventually we may open another issue and close this one for management purposes, in which case we'll link the new issue here.

Current to-do list:
- [ ] Cast to uint needed on Graphics.SetTexture(uint index) when using TextureUnit enum (int)
- [ ] Image doesn't have a method to set all the pixels at once, nor a rectangular area on it
- [ ] 'Constants' class has too many responsibility, buttons/keys, texture masks, animation and video settings... while names are organized, it feels a bit strange
- [ ] Provide an intuitive way to activate CCD for a RigidBody2D other than "SetBullet()" which is very counterintuitive and confusing
- [ ]

data.title: [TypeScript] Generate native event constants and interface exports
Added animation preview tool bar
data.body:
Created an animation preview toolbar to test out animations at custom playback speeds. It also allows the user to blend between 2 specified animations using custom blend speeds.

Open the window by clicking on the Preview Animation Button that now appears in the inspector when the user has a model selected.

data.title: Add an AtomicTool Project command
data.body:
Currently includes a cache task, with an option to clean the cache first

usage: AtomicTool project "path\to\project" [cache (-clean)]

Addresses #1199

data.title: [AtomicTool] Add a project command to import project items/generate the cache
data.body: Let's add a (re)generate cache command to AtomicTool, it is possible this should be a ProjectCmd with a "cache" operation, so like AtomicTool project cache --clean would remove cache files, AtomicTool project cache generate would generate cache, AtomicTool project cache generate --clean would clean and then generate cache, etc

data.title: Enable linux accelerator keys
data.body: The way the control/Command key was being handled wrong for linux. It was falling into the OSX behavior with a Command key, when it actually follows the Windows Control key behavior.

data.title: [2D] Rain catch of small 2D issues

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
- [x] Particle emitters have no way to stop them from emitting, disabling removes all particles for emitter from scene
- [ ] 2D physics collision events have a b2contact cast as void* in them and are not accessible in script 
- [x] Expose PhysicsWorld2D.Raycast()

data.title: [Build] Support excluding C++ examples from parent builds
data.body:
Allow to exclude examples from build by setting ATOMIC_CPLUSPLUS_EXAMPLES in parent project.

Export ATOMIC_CXX11, ATOMIC_64BIT, ATOMIC_BUILD_DIST (allows parent projects to use Atomic's c++11 support).

data.title: [Editor] Implement tooltip system for core class inspector fields

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body: This will likely take the form of a file which maps namespace.class.field to string entries for the inspector to display tooltips.  This is also an opportunity to introduce the localization subsystem, can start with english

data.title: [C#] Add tooltip support for script exposed variables
data.body:
- [ ] Add hover tooltip support to inspectors
- [ ] Add a description or tooltip parameter to the [Inspector] attribute
- [ ] Expose that value to the CSComponent inspector

data.title: [Windows] Support Direct3D 9/11 and OpenGL build configurations
data.body:
The "--d3d11" or "--opengl" flags can now be specified on the command line to both Build_AtomicEditor.bat and GenerateVS2015.bat to switch graphics libraries.

DirectX 9 remains the default if no flags are specified.

resolves #1155

data.title: [Website] Simplification and Updates
data.body: The website is crusty and needs a scouring, planning to collapse pages, tighten, and present the Atomic technology better.  Also, download page will become builds page, with messaging on what builds/milestones are...

data.title: macOS: Native File Dialog locks editor UI

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
This may be a duplicate, but I couldn't find it.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open the Editor.
2. Click "Open Project" button or select "File"->"Open Project".
3. Choose a project to open and press the "Open" button.

After step 3 UI stops rendering and stops responding to click events.

Opening a project from the "Recent Projects" menu is not affected. Only situations that cause the native file dialog to appear cause the UI to lock.

data.title: [Editor] Fix up default project template language selection
data.body: In a pinch, default to JavaScript as this will always work, right now we default to C# with an info box about downloading visual studio/xamarin studio if these are missing.  When the dialog box closes, the "new project" dialog also goes away which is poor for usability

data.title: [CMake] Remove Atomic include_directories in root CMakeLists.txt
data.body:
QtCreator 4.1+ should fix this issue

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L28

data.title: Add build configuration for Visual Studio 2017 and Visual Studio Mac
data.body: Now that VS2017 is in RC and VSMac is in preview, there should be build configurations for them.  This should be relatively straight forward, however does touch the native and AtomicNET builds.

data.title: Stop crash from null objects at exit 248
data.body: This pr will stop crashes from accessing null objects in user event handlers by not issuing Update events once the application has started to exit.

data.title: Shortcut fixes for #697
data.body:
This hooks up the editor menu shortcuts properly and fixes #697

Edit->Undo 
Edit->Redo
Edit->Cut
Edit->Copy
Edit->Paste
Edit->Select All
Edit->Format Code

Testing was done on OSX, but this needs to also be tested in Linux and Windows since the shortcut keys are different (CMD becomes CTRL in Windows and Linux).

This also fixes some linter errors in the TS.

data.title: Update AUTHORS.md
allow node.createJSComponent without extension
Add audio strings into bindings for 1152
data.body:
This will allow const String constants in general to be bound into both JS and C#.  I thought that this might match other instances in the Atomic source code, but the Audio strings were the only ones.
I freely admit to repurposing the char primitive type to represent a string for the module constants, for two reasons, only numeric constants were being registered, and changing the primitives type enum could have compatibility issues.

data.title: [C#] - Evaluate necessity of building GenerateAtomicNET target for dev builds

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
It is currently necessary to build the GenerateAtomicNET target after building a VS2015/XCode/QtCreator/Make solution for development builds.  

The editor binary build does this automatically, evaluate having dev build do this as well... could also be an opportunity to tie in build scripts closer with the CMake_* files or consolidate with AtomicBuild.sh/AtomicBuild.bat and have aliases for VS2015/VS2017, XCode, Make, Dev, Editor

data.title: Add necessary functionality from Source/Tools to ToolCore

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tree/master/Source/Tools contains some legacy command line tools, the remaining functionality needs to be defined and then added to ToolCore so it is available in the AtomicEditor and AtomicTool.  These tools can then be removed from the repository.  See comments below.

data.title: [WebGL] - Refactor WebGL deployment for new Jenkins build
data.body: WebGL currently compiles/runs though the CI isn't configured to generate/package deployment for binary editor builds.

data.title: Misc enhancements including fix for focusing skeletal models
data.body: Please see #1150

data.title: [Editor] - Skeletal bounding box off for models as bones are not created in editor
data.body: This is related to how prefabs are currently using temporary flag.

data.title: [UI] - Support render targets for UI in 3D scenes and 2D transforms (including input injection)

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
This makes the UI usable within 3D scenes, 2D transforms, etc.

Corresponding PR: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1165

data.title: [Example, C#] Add simple code driven example of drawing a Quad
data.body:
This example will show how to rendering a quad using only low level graphics API and without using any resources from the resource cache

There is work ongoing in the examples repo: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples/pull/92

data.title: [Website] Cut a new Atomic demo reel video for landing page
data.body: Update the current landing page video (from March 2015!) with a new demo reel video featuring all the latest and greatest Atomic technology.
